title: Problem moving messages from one folder to another - possible QuickFolders problem?
creator: tcluster
content:
Hello,

I'm having a problem moving messages from one folder to another. There's one message which will not move no matter what I do. I'd like to turn off QuickFolders so that I can determine whether it causes the problem. How do I turn QuickFolders off, and then when I'm done with my experiment, turn it back on again?

title: Thunderbird says password or settings are incorrect for iCloud mail
creator: shiningprince77-firefox
content:
Thunderbird says password or settings are incorrect for iCloud mail. I have tried everything AI suggested. I use a custom domain on icloud and I have even tried using the underlying icloud address as login. Nothing works. The app password is newly generated and I tried it with and without hyphens.

Please help

title: Thunderbird Daily vs. Release version, subject line in bold format and email address display format
creator: bengar
content:
I recently went back from Thunderbird daily to the release channel when I set up my new PC.

1. On opening an email - The Subject display in Daily Version is Bold and according to the font as set in Thunderbird Settings. Just Perfect. It is not the same in the Release Channel. Looks not so nice.

2. In Release Channel -- under settings If I choose to display the "Name Only" under Message List for address display format. It ignores

3. Release channel is ver 146.0.1 .. If I go back to Thunderbird daily .. will I be able to use the same profile used for the Release channel?

With my thanks in advance
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: NNTP: Thunderbird not working with newly added newsgroup accounts
creator: grahamperrin
content:
My profile did previously work with news.eternal-september.org, although I very rarely used NNTP. The last active use might have been as long as July or August 2023.

A few days ago I added news.gmane.io, it did not appear in the sidebar.

news.eternal-september.org:

  • was originally in the sidebar, and responsive
  • is not in the sidebar after removing then re-adding the account.

Can anyone reproduce this issue?

Environment

Thunderbird 140.0.1 (64-bit) on Kubuntu 25.10. Neither Flatpak nor Snap; my configured software sources include packages.mozilla.org/apt/ for deb.

/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/packages.mozilla.org.asc exists.

The profile was previously used on FreeBSD 15.0-CURRENT, if that's relevant.

title: Desktop Inbox does not see reply sent via Mobile app in the thread
creator: keith.cobby1
content:
When I reply to an email using the Android Mobile App, in a thread that was created on the Desktop App, the email reply does not show up in the desktop nor the mobile app threads. It does however, show up in the thread in the Sent folder on both Mobile and Desktop.

It's as if there is no syncing of the thread to the Desktop or Mobile Inbox.

All emails are IMAP
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;os:Linux KDE

title: Tools not working
creator: andy191
content: My Thunderbird inbox stopped accepting messages with a message 'Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges, and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox.' I 'repaired' the folder but all my junk messages suddenly reappeared in my inbox (a lot of them!). Tools didn;t work (wanted to re-apply junk filter). Went into safe mode - no difference. Now can't get any tools to work on the inbox folder. Not sure what to try next. Help much appreciated.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:146.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/146.0;os:Windows 11
